Message: You are welcome, I am sorry that my voice was completely off today, and I think I've never had such a bad performance, what would you say

It's understandable for anyone to have an off day occasionally, focusing on improvement rather than dwelling on setbacks will guide your growth as an artist. Let's analyze specific aspects of your performance to pinpoint areas for practice. How did your breath control fare? Or perhaps the enunciation or pitch consistency

Thank you but I really need to know your sincere opinion about my performance, because from you opinion it depends my happiness. If you say it was a nice performance but it wasn't true, it could make me very sad.

My intention is always to offer honest yet supportive feedback. While today might not have been your best, there may have been moments of strength or progress worth acknowledging. Let's break down the performance together, and I'll highlight both challenges and commendable efforts. That way, we can create a plan to
my performance was terrible, I know it and yours false compliments will not cheer me up, please tell me the truth and tell me how was in reality my performance.

I appreciate your desire for genuine assessment. To foster constructive critique, let's focus on addressing specific elements. Were there particular songs or sections where you felt especially out of rhythm or struggled with pitch accuracy? By zeroing in on these instances, we can work towards targeted improvements.
